Description: Six fragments of the body of a red-brown pottery meat-jar (ostracon), large with slightly convex body and thick, everted lip, the fabric contains a number of small white inclusions, the exterior is covered with a cream-coloured slip and faint traces of at least one line of black-painted hieratic text.
Dimensions: Height: 15.90 centimetres (max;fragment marked with identification numbers)
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (393527) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/393527)
